title: Vikings Mike Zimmer: Sam Bradford Has Earned The Right To Be The Starter | Vikings Blog | KFAN FM 100.3
text:
Alexander Shun | @alexpshun 
Digital Content Manager | KFAN.com 
The quarterback controversy is only just beginning for the Minnesota Vikings, but Tuesday head coach Mike Zimmer gave his take on the QB competition. 
"I think Sam [Bradford] has played great this year, number one," Zimmer said. "I think he's earned the right to be the starting quarterback and right now all I'm worried about is Teddy getting better." 
Zimmer is right, Bradford did play great football this season, finishing with 3,877 yards, 20 touchdowns, five interceptions and a 99.3 passer rating while setting the single-season completion percentage record. 
The 'incumbent' Teddy Bridgewater is still recovering from a dislocated knee and torn ACL that he suffered just a few weeks before the start of the regular season. While an exact timetable for Bridgewater's return was difficult to determine given the extent of the injury, it was assumed that Bridgewater would in fact be ready to play next season. Whether or not that will be the case remains to be seen, but Zimmer is going to wait until Bridgewater is fully healthy before looking at any sort of quarterback competition. 
"We will worry about those things later," Zimmer said, speaking about the potential of a QB controversy. "Sam has done remarkable, the things he's done this year with all the things he's had to do." 
As for Bradford's take on potentially being the starter next season, it wasn't even a thought that had crossed his mind. 
"That is so far of my radar. I haven't even begun to think about next year," Bradford said post-game on Sunday. " Obviously this year has been a whirlwind since the day I got here...I'm definitely going to take some time and catch my breath for awhile." 
Bridgewater is continuing to rehab and such a process will be closely tracked, but from everything Zimmer told media members Tuesday - and not surprisingly, I might add - it appears as though Bradford will be the starter until Bridgewater is healthy and ready to play.
